channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024070166
item.description:
Report X-2024070166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hub QA in a red Haz tote. Upon further inspection found metal pail leaking internal contents due to poor lid closure; paint clips bent. Metal pail is dented at top and bottom of container.

item.title: Report X-2024070246
item.description:
Report X-2024070246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the INDH location. The fiberboard box contained a single can of spray paint, fully released and some metal office files to keep the paint can from rolling around. Paint can label was covered with duct tape. There were no DG marking or paperwork required for transport. Package was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On june 25th a box marked as UN1266 Perfumery Products was found damaged and leaking. it is unknown how the damage to the box occurred however 3 bottles inside of the package were broken and leaked their contents. The package was placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers dec and further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024070003
item.description:
Report E-2024070003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of sodium hydroxide was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal.
